content.description:
P1) 5.11a   Climb Pitch 1 of “Road to Amritsar”

P2) 5.11a.  Follow the cracks up to a ledge. from here go up  and left past a couple bolts to some hollow flakes and cracks to anchor.

P3) 5.12a   Follow cracks and flakes up and left to a Bouldery bolt protected crux, to a finger crack which leads to the anchor.

P4) 5.11c   Climb the finger crack above to a chain anchor. 
Descent: Rappel

SR to 2”  Tripples: 0.2 - 0.4” cams


All Anchors Bolted

climbs.name: Road to Amritsar
climbs.fa: FA : Harry Young, Colin Moorhead, Jason Green. June 2015.

content.description:
Steep, exposed, continuously good. Mostly finger to tight hands, with a short overhanging chimney crux !

P1 11a: Steep corner dual cracks lead over a tricky bulge to a big ledge. 11a

P2 11c: Beautiful corner. Money. Stem, layback, and grovel up an overhanging chimney crux. 11c

P3 10d: Very fun glory hands lead up and traverse left, before entering somewhat-hollow sounding flakes. Type 1 fun.

P4 11b: Very exposed and *stellar* thin hands, with a great crux! Topout on wide ledge

P5 9: Short fist jamming pitch to trees. Feels like a logical conclusion

P6 11c: If you choose to do it, the true crux. Sweaty rock, ring locks, and odd movement. 



Obvious line in the corner up to the right at the base. Look for the bulge with dual cracks leading up.

Bolted anchors. triples of finger to hand size.
Steep cliff to lookers left of Photophobia Buttress and Dog Cliff. Quality, beautiful, harder cracks in a great setting.
